sen.j: 下海上国造（しもつうなかみのくにみやつこ・しもつうなかみこくぞう)は下総国東部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Shimotsuunakami kuninomiyatsuko 下海上国造 was kuninomiyatsuko ruled the east part of Shimousa Province.
Shimotsuunakami kuninomiyatsuko 下海上国造 was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the east part of Shimousa Province.
sen.cmt: local ruling families in ancient Japan を追加しました。
sen.e: Shimotsuunakami kuninomiyatsuko 下海上国造 was kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) ruled the east part of Shimousa Province.
It is also written as 下菟上国造.
It is also written as 下菟上国造.
It is also written as 下菟上国造.
According to "Kojiki", Takehiyodorinomikoto.
According to "Kojiki" (Records of Ancient Matters), the ancestor was Takehinadori no Mikoto.
sen.cmt: Records of Ancient Matters を追加表現を変えました。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki" (Records of Ancient Matters), the ancestor was Takehinadori no Mikoto.

sen.j: 別名は武夷鳥命・天夷鳥命・天日照命など。
sen.e: Pseudonyms were Takehiyodorinomikoto, Amenohinadorinomikoto, Amenohinaderinomikoto, and the like.
Pseudonyms were Takehinadori no Mikoto, Amenohinatori no Mikoto, Amenohinaderi no Mikoto, and the like.
Pseudonyms were Takehinadori no Mikoto, Amenohinatori no Mikoto, Amenohinaderi no Mikoto, and the like.
He was a son of Amenohohinokami.
He was a son of Amenohohinokami.
He was a son of Amenohohinokami.

sen.j: 『国造本紀』その7世孫忍立化多比が成務天皇朝に上海上国造になり、その孫久都伎直が応神天皇朝に下海上国造になったという。
sen.e: According to "Kuninomiyatsuko hongi", Oshitatutakehi, the 7th descendant from Takehiyodorinomikoto, became Kamitsuunakaminokunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu, and a grandson of Oshitatutakehi became Shimotsuunakaminokunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Onin.

According to "Kokuzo hongi" (the original record of provincial governors), Oshitateketahi, the 7th descendant from Takehiyodori no Mikoto, became Kamitsuunakami no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu, and a grandson of Oshitatutakehi became Shimotsuunakami no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Onin.
sen.cmt: the original record of provincial governorsを追加しました。Kuninomiyatsuko hongi→Kokuzo hongi (the original record of provincial governors)Oshitatutakehi→Oshitateketahi
sen.e: According to "Kokuzo hongi" (the original record of provincial governors), Oshitateketahi, the 7th descendant from Takehiyodori no Mikoto, became Kamitsuunakami no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Seimu, and a grandson of Oshitatutakehi became Shimotsuunakami no kunimiyatsuko during the reign of Emperor Onin.

sen.j: 敏達天皇の孫百済王の末裔。
sen.e: He was a descendant from Kudaranokonikishishi, a grandson of Emperor Bidatsu.
He was a descendant from Kudaranokonikishi (King of Paekche), a grandson of Emperor Bidatsu.
sen.cmt: King of Paekcheを追加スペルミス修正→shi 削除
sen.e: He was a descendant from Kudaranokonikishi (King of Paekche), a grandson of Emperor Bidatsu.

sen.j: 出雲氏......出雲国造・武蔵国造・上海上国造・伊甚国造・遠淡海国造などと同系。
sen.e: The Izumo clan: It was descended from the same line as Izumonokuninomiyatsuko, Musashinokuninomiyatsuko, Kamituunakamikuninomiyatsuko, Ijimunokuninomiyatsuko, Tootsuominokuninomiyatsuko, and the like.

The Izumo clan: It was descended from the same line as Izumo no kuninomiyatsuko, Musashi no kuninomiyatsuko, Kamituunakami kuninomiyatsuko, Ijimu no kuninomiyatsuko, Tootsuomi no kuninomiyatsuko, and the like.
